page.title: 04R.A.F WOODBRIDGE:SUTTON
page.content:
Towards the east of the block is {R.A.F. Woodbridge}a{U.S.A.F. airbase. It is completely American run and it is not open to the public except on {Open Days and Air displays.
The military aircraft flown from here are{Thunderbolts, Hercules, and{"Jolly Green Giant"}helicopters which frequently fly over the surrounding area.
There are two long runways and a large housing area which is nearly self-sufficent with schools, {Commissaries}and{Messes.
{In June 1985, the whole area was {cordoned off when a live bomb fell {from its loading trolley smashing the {leg of one of the ground crew.
